suite2p.utils¶

Module Contents¶

suite2p.utils.tic()[source]¶
suite2p.utils.toc(i0)[source]¶
suite2p.utils.fitMVGaus(y, x, lam, thres=2.5)[source]¶

computes 2D gaussian fit to data and returns ellipse of radius thres standard deviations.

Parameters

  • y (float, array) – pixel locations in y

  • x (float, array) – pixel locations in x

  • lam (float, array) – weights of each pixel

Returns

  • mu (float) – mean of gaussian fit.

  • cov (float) – covariance of gaussian fit.

  • radii (float, array) – half of major and minor axis lengths of elliptical fit.

  • ellipse (float, array) – coordinates of elliptical fit.

  • area (float) – area of ellipse.

suite2p.utils.enhanced_mean_image(ops)[source]¶

computes enhanced mean image and adds it to ops

Median filters ops[‘meanImg’] with 4*diameter in 2D and subtracts and divides by this median-filtered image to return a high-pass filtered image ops[‘meanImgE’]

Parameters

ops (dictionary) – uses ‘meanImg’, ‘aspect’, ‘diameter’, ‘yrange’ and ‘xrange’

Returns

ops – ‘meanImgE’ field added

Return type

dictionary

suite2p.utils.init_ops(ops)[source]¶

initializes ops files for each plane in recording

Parameters

ops (dictionary) – ‘nplanes’, ‘save_path’, ‘save_folder’, ‘fast_disk’, ‘nchannels’, ‘keep_movie_raw’ + (if mesoscope) ‘dy’, ‘dx’, ‘lines’

Returns

ops1 – adds fields ‘save_path0’, ‘reg_file’ (depending on ops: ‘raw_file’, ‘reg_file_chan2’, ‘raw_file_chan2’)

Return type

list of dictionaries

suite2p.utils.list_h5(ops)[source]¶
suite2p.utils.find_files_open_binaries(ops1, ish5)[source]¶

finds tiffs or h5 files and opens binaries for writing

Parameters

ops1 (list of dictionaries) – ‘keep_movie_raw’, ‘data_path’, ‘look_one_level_down’, ‘reg_file’…

Returns

ops1 – adds fields ‘filelist’, ‘first_tiffs’, opens binaries

Return type

list of dictionaries

suite2p.utils.h5py_to_binary(ops)[source]¶

finds h5 files and writes them to binaries

Parameters

ops (dictionary) – ‘nplanes’, ‘h5_path’, ‘h5_key’, ‘save_path’, ‘save_folder’, ‘fast_disk’, ‘nchannels’, ‘keep_movie_raw’, ‘look_one_level_down’

Returns

ops1 – ‘Ly’, ‘Lx’, ops1[j][‘reg_file’] or ops1[j][‘raw_file’] is created binary

Return type

list of dictionaries

suite2p.utils.open_tiff(file, sktiff)[source]¶

opens tiff with either ScanImageTiffReader or skimage returns tiff and its length

suite2p.utils.choose_tiff_reader(fs0, ops)[source]¶

chooses tiff reader (ScanImageTiffReader is default)

tries to open tiff with ScanImageTiffReader and if it fails sets sktiff to True

Parameters

  • fs0 (string) – path to first tiff in list

  • ops (dictionary) – ‘batch_size’

Returns

sktiff – whether or not to use scikit-image tiff reader

Return type

bool

suite2p.utils.tiff_to_binary(ops)[source]¶

finds tiff files and writes them to binaries

Parameters

ops (dictionary) – ‘nplanes’, ‘data_path’, ‘save_path’, ‘save_folder’, ‘fast_disk’, ‘nchannels’, ‘keep_movie_raw’, ‘look_one_level_down’

Returns

ops1 – ops1[j][‘reg_file’] or ops1[j][‘raw_file’] is created binary assigns keys ‘Ly’, ‘Lx’, ‘tiffreader’, ‘first_tiffs’, ‘frames_per_folder’, ‘nframes’, ‘meanImg’, ‘meanImg_chan2’

Return type

list of dictionaries

suite2p.utils.mesoscan_to_binary(ops)[source]¶

finds mesoscope tiff files and writes them to binaries

Parameters

ops (dictionary) – ‘nplanes’, ‘data_path’, ‘save_path’, ‘save_folder’, ‘fast_disk’, ‘nchannels’, ‘keep_movie_raw’, ‘look_one_level_down’, ‘lines’, ‘dx’, ‘dy’

Returns

ops1 – ops1[j][‘reg_file’] or ops1[j][‘raw_file’] is created binary assigns keys ‘Ly’, ‘Lx’, ‘tiffreader’, ‘first_tiffs’, ‘frames_per_folder’, ‘nframes’, ‘meanImg’, ‘meanImg_chan2’

Return type

list of dictionaries

suite2p.utils.list_tifs(froot, look_one_level_down)[source]¶

get list of tiffs in folder froot + one level down maybe

suite2p.utils.get_tif_list(ops)[source]¶

make list of tiffs to process if ops[‘subfolders’], then all tiffs ops[‘data_path’][0] / ops[‘subfolders’] / *.tif if ops[‘look_one_level_down’], then all tiffs in all folders + one level down if ops[‘tiff_list’], then ops[‘data_path’][0] / ops[‘tiff_list’] ONLY

suite2p.utils.sub2ind(array_shape, rows, cols)[source]¶
suite2p.utils.combined(ops1)[source]¶

Combines all the entries in ops1 into a single result file.

Multi-plane recordings are arranged to best tile a square. Multi-roi recordings are arranged by their dx,dy physical localization.

suite2p.utils.make_blocks(ops)[source]¶

computes overlapping blocks to split FOV into to register separately

Parameters

ops (dictionary) – ‘Ly’, ‘Lx’ (optional ‘block_size’)

Returns

ops – ‘yblock’, ‘xblock’, ‘nblocks’, ‘NRsm’

Return type

dictionary

suite2p.utils.sample_frames(ops, ix, reg_file, crop=True)[source]¶

get frames ix from reg_file frames are cropped by ops[‘yrange’] and ops[‘xrange’]

suite2p.utils.ome_to_binary(ops)[source]¶

converts ome.tiff to *.bin file for non-interleaved red channel recordings assumes SINGLE-PAGE tiffs where first channel has string ‘Ch1’ and also SINGLE FOLDER

Parameters

ops (dictionary) – keys nplanes, nchannels, data_path, look_one_level_down, reg_file

Returns

ops1 – creates binaries ops1[j][‘reg_file’] assigns keys: tiffreader, first_tiffs, frames_per_folder, nframes, meanImg, meanImg_chan2

Return type

list of dictionaries
